title: Understanding R-squared
text: The R-squared value is a statistical measure that represents the proportion of the variance for a dependent variable that's explained by an independent variable or variables in a regression model.

title: Range of R-squared
text: R-squared values range from $$0$$ to $$1$$. A value closer to $$1$$ indicates a stronger relationship between the variables.

hintAnswer: a number from $$0$$ to $$1$$ that measures the strength of the trend
title: Choosing the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes the R-squared value?
choices: a number from $$0$$ to $$1$$ that measures the strength of the trend
a number from $$0$$ to $$100$$ that measures the strength of the trend
a number from $$0$$ to $$1$$ that measures the strength of the data
a number from $$0$$ to $$100$$ that measures the strength of the data
